intro: Cheniella corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered Cheniella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Cheniella corymbosa is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
